relation: Possibly from 真珠 shinju (pearl), a reference to Pokémon Pearl. Could also be named after 宮崎慎二 Shinji Miyazaki.
From the name 真司 Shinji. Also similar to 真珠 zhēnzhū (pearl).
pageTitle: Difference between revisions of "Paul" - Bulbapedia, the community-driven Pokémon encyclopedia
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {98043=Paul chose Magmortar to replace his Chimchar after he released it. It first debuted in Lost Leader Strategy! as a Magmar where it appeared in a flashback. Magmar made its first real appearance in Aiding the Enemy!, sleeping with Paul's other Pokémon.}
textBeforeTable: Names Paul is the only trainer to abandon one of Ash's Fire type Pokémon that has been seen more than once outside of flashbacks. Paul has used a Pokémon of every type except for the Psychic-type and the Dragon-type. Paul and Ash also have three Pokémon in common that come from the same evolutionary families: two Torterra, two Gliscor, and a Glalie & a Froslass. Paul has three Pokémon in common with Ash's original rival, Gary Oak: Electivire, Nidoking and Magmar. Paul shares his Japanese name with that of Lake Verity. Paul has been defeated onscreen three times, and each time three of his Pokémon debuted. Paul is the first regular rival seen capturing a Pokémon on screen. Three of Ash's Pokémon have evolved while battling against Paul: Turtwig into Grotle, Staravia into Staraptor, and Chimchar into Monferno. Both Turtwig and Staravia evolved while battling Honchkrow. Paul was first revealed to the fandom through a CoroCoro scan that showed him alongside Ash and Dawn commanding a Chimchar. However, his name and role was not revealed until the
